definitions.definition: a liquid that is put on surfaces to give them a particular colour; a layer of this liquid when it has dried on a surface

examples.text: The woodwork has recently been given a fresh **coat of paint**.
The paint is starting to peel off.
The house is desperately in need of **a lick of paint** *(= a new coat of paint)*.
We did a quick **paint job** on the car *(= a new coat of paint to make it look better)* and hoped the damage wasn't noticeable.
The aircraft have been repainted in the original red and black paint scheme.
The artist has used several layers of paint to create the stormy sky.
The stove is available in two metallic paint finishes.

definitions.definition: tubes or blocks of paint used for painting pictures

examples.text: an artist working with acrylic paints

wordOrigin: Middle English: from peint ‘painted’, past participle of Old French peindre, from Latin pingere ‘to paint’.
